page.title: 07A MAN AND WIFE IN JARROW
page.content: {Mrs. Smith}has been employed in her present job for two years, as a secretary in a bank. Mrs. Smith works seven hours a day, five days a week. Her day starts at 9am. and finishes at 5pm. She has a fifteen minute coffee break at 10am and a lunch break from 12am to 1pm. {Mr. Smith}has been unemployed for seven months. His last job, which lasted for only one year, was a community programmer. He earned Â£65 per week but now he is only entitled to unemployment benefit of Â£27.25 plus family allowance. A typical day in his life is a visit to the Job Centre with the rest of the day spent doing odd jobs around the house and in the garden. Without Mrs. Smith's income the family would find it very hard to survive.
